sources.title: Submarine Alert (1943) | Colorized Public Domain WWII Spy Thriller with Richard Arlen & Wendy Barrie
sources.description:
Submarine Alert (1943) is an American World War II spy thriller directed by Frank McDonald and released by Paramount Pictures. This restored and colorized public domain classic blends espionage, wartime propaganda, and suspense, offering audiences a gripping narrative set against the backdrop of submarine warfare and secret intelligence operations. With Richard Arlen in the lead and Wendy Barrie as his partner in intrigue, the film captures the tension and urgency of a world at war while delivering fast-paced drama to audiences then and now.

Plot Summary:
During the height of World War II, American pilot Chris Reynolds (Richard Arlen) is recruited into a covert intelligence mission after demonstrating bravery and skill. Tasked with uncovering and disrupting a network of enemy spies operating on U.S. soil, Chris must navigate a web of deception, coded messages, and deadly risks. His mission becomes even more dangerous when it leads him to uncover a plot involving submarine sabotage designed to cripple Allied defenses.

Assisting him is Jane (Wendy Barrie), a sharp and resourceful woman who provides both romance and resilience amid the wartime chaos. Together, they must infiltrate the spy ring, gather intelligence, and prevent a catastrophic attack. Along the way, Chris encounters treachery, double agents, and the constant threat of exposure. Suspense builds as the investigation converges on a dramatic climax, where one wrong move could mean disaster for both the mission and the war effort.

Cast and Crew:

â€¢ Producer: Pine-Thomas Productions for Paramount Pictures
â€¢ Cinematography: Fred Jackman Jr.
â€¢ Editing: William H. Ziegler

â€¢ Roger Pryor as Lt. Cmdr. Hennessey
â€¢ Marc Lawrence as Steve
â€¢ Abner Biberman as Mike
â€¢ Ralph Sanford as Sidekick
â€¢ Roy Barcroft as Henchman

Film Significance:
Submarine Alert is one of several wartime thrillers produced to boost morale and remind American audiences of the threats posed by Axis espionage. Its mix of patriotic fervor, espionage intrigue, and naval warfare reflects Hollywoodâ€™s role in shaping public perception during World War II. Richard Arlen, already established as an action star from films like Wings (1927), brings heroism and authority to the role, while Wendy Barrieâ€™s presence offers balance through intelligence and determination. The film remains an example of B-movie wartime entertainment, capturing both the anxieties and the determination of its era.

Enhanced Public Domain Explanation:
This film is in the public domain, which means it is completely free of copyright restrictions and can be legally shared, viewed, studied, and preserved without limitation. Colorized Public Domain restores and enhances these historic works through careful digital cleaning, visual restoration, and colorization techniques. Our mission is to ensure that timeless classics like Submarine Alert remain available to a worldwide audience. By presenting them in color and modern quality, we make them more engaging and accessible to younger generations who might otherwise overlook black-and-white cinema. This process respects the original film while providing a new layer of appreciation for todayâ€™s viewers.

Why Watch This Colorized Edition:
The original 1943 release was presented in black and white, a standard of its time. While authentic to the wartime context, many modern audiences overlook monochrome films. By offering a colorized edition, we create a bridge between historical preservation and contemporary viewing habits. The enhanced visuals allow present-day audiences in the United States, Europe, and beyond to engage more deeply with the filmâ€™s espionage tension, submarine warfare sequences, and patriotic themes.

sources.title: Submarine Alert
sources.description: From IMDB : Nazi spies use a stolen shortwave transmitter prototype to broadcast top secret shipping info to an offshore Japanese sub. To nab the spy ring, the Government has the West Coast's top radio engineers fired and shadowed to see if the Nazis recruit them to complete work on the prototype radio. Radio engineer Lew Deerhold, a resident alien without a job to pay for his adorable little ward Gina's life-saving operation, falls prey to the spy ring, and is swept up in a maelstrom of deceit and danger.

sources.title: Submarine Alert (1943) WWII-THRILLER
sources.description:
Stars: Richard Arlen, Wendy Barrie and Nils Asther
Director: Frank McDonald
Writer: Maxwell Shane (original screenplay)

Nazi spies use a stolen shortwave transmitter prototype to broadcast top secret shipping info to an offshore Japanese submarine!

sources.title: Submarine Alert (1943) Richard Arlen | Full Length Thriller, War, Spy Movie
sources.description:
Nazi spies use a stolen shortwave transmitter prototype to broadcast top secret shipping info to an offshore Japanese sub. To nab the spy ring, the Government has the West Coast's top radio engineers fired and shadowed to see if the Nazis recruit them to complete work on the prototype radio. Radio engineer Lew Deerhold, a resident alien without a job to pay for his adorable little ward Gina's life-saving operation, falls prey to the spy ring, and is swept up in a maelstrom of deceit and danger.

Writer: Maxwell Shane
